Payroll_InputObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Payroll_InputObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Payroll_InputObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

External_Payroll_Input_Request_Reference.description: Unique identifier for an External Payroll Input

description: Utilize the Request References element to retrieve a specific instance(s) of External Payroll Input and its associated data.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

External_Payroll_Input_Request_Criteria.description: Unique identifier used to reference an Payee (e.g. Employee).

Pay_ComponentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Pay_ComponentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Pay_ComponentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

External_Payroll_Input_Request_Criteria.description: Unique identifier used to reference a Pay Component (e.g. Earning, Deduction)

Application_BatchObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Application_BatchObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Application_BatchObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Utilize the Request Criteria element to filter the returned population to those External Payroll Input entries that meet ALL of the criteria.

validation.validation: The Pay Component Calculation Category must be Payroll Interface and the Payroll Input Type for the Pay Component Code must be Adjustment, Input, or Ongoing.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Parameters that let you filter the data returned in the response. You can filter returned data by dates and page attributes.
